page.title: 17ASDA v The Local Shop.
page.content: The area is served with the usual collection of small, local shops and one large{ASDA Superstore.}But which type of shop do people prefer? {"You can't beat the friendly service {of the corner shop",}says one old lady.{"They're good places to catch up {on all the gossip",}she added. However, not all agree.{"Shopping is {such hard work",}say one young couple. {"At least at ASDA we can get a week's {shopping done quickly." The price advantage is often mentioned too.{"Very competetive",}said one man. Certainly those with busy lives or keen money savers preferred ASDA. But perhaps the last word should go to the school girl who said,{"I'd never {go to ASDA to buy my 1O pence worth {of spice!"
